DocumentPublisher.IssuingAuthority: Cisco product security incident response is the responsibility of the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT). The Cisco PSIRT is a dedicated, global team that manages the receipt, investigation, and public reporting of security vulnerability information that is related to Cisco products and networks. The on-call Cisco PSIRT works 24x7 with Cisco customers, independent security researchers, consultants, industry organizations, and other vendors to identify possible security issues with Cisco products and networks. More information can be found in Cisco Security Vulnerability Policy available at http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html

Vulnerability.Title: Cisco NX-OS Malformed IP Packet Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
Cisco NX-OS Software is affected by a denial of service vulnerability
that can cause Cisco Nexus 1000v Series Switches, Cisco Nexus 5000
Series Switches and Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches running affected versions of Cisco NX-OS Software to
reload when the IP stack processes a malformed IP packet.
